qas.question: What did Nobel Laureate Hans Bethe think of von NEumann's ability?

answers.text: I have sometimes wondered whether a brain like von Neumann's does not indicate a species superior to that of man

qas.question: What did James Glimm have to say about von Nuemann?

answers.text: he is regarded as one of the giants of modern mathematics

qas.question: What description did Peter Lax use for von Neumann?

answers.text: most scintillating intellect of this century

context: "<a0_0>I have sometimes wondered whether a brain like von Neumann's does not indicate a species superior to that of man<a0_0/>", said Nobel Laureate Hans Bethe of Cornell University. "It seems fair to say that if the influence of a scientist is interpreted broadly enough to include impact on fields beyond science proper, then John von Neumann was probably the most influential mathematician who ever lived," wrote Miklós Rédei in "Selected Letters." James Glimm wrote: "<a1_0>he is regarded as one of the giants of modern mathematics<a1_0/>". The mathematician Jean Dieudonné called von Neumann "the last of the great mathematicians", while Peter Lax described him as possessing the "<a2_0>most scintillating intellect of this century<a2_0/>".
